Recap: At Cedars, a very good-looking doctor (played by the actor, Fabio) treats Cassie for her ankle injury. She tells Josh she doesn't need treatment and Josh tries to ask the doctor his likes and dislikes, obviously trying to set him and Cassie up. Cassie tells Josh she doesn't need a man in her life. Jeffrey and Blake make campaign interviews and the interviewers ask Cassie and Josh who they trust and for whom they will vote. Cassie says she trusts each of them. Jeffrey discovers that Ross's assistant, Nicole, was an investigator and has a female partner of 10 years. He realizes that Ross wasn't having an affair. Blake gets in his car as he is leaving and suddenly comes on to him. They kiss and the passion gets heated. She suddenly slaps him and tells him that she is trying to get over Ross and he is trying to get over Cassie. Also, her brain is shut-off sometimes. They end up debating the campaign issues and tell the other they are adamant about not dropping out of the mayoral race.

Buzz finds Coop at the airport trying to get a refund on his England plane ticket. He talks Coop into coming back to Company. Lizzie tells Ava to let Coop go and Jonathan agrees. Ava is suspicious about Jonathan having spent time with Lizzie and he actually has a flashback of Lizzie and their passionate night together. Tammy takes Lizzie's side and tries to console her when Ava verbally attacks Lizzie. Coop tells Lizzie he needs to talk to Ava and proceeds to tell Ava the time is not right for their relationship. Ava disagrees and tells him he is stuck with her. Josh is so excited that Reva is coming home. As a very excited Reva arrives at the airport, she staggers and drops her packages. The closing music playing, Reva has difficulty focusing, bends down to pick up her packages and falls to the floor.
Transcript: Cassie: Why are we even here, Josh. I'm fine. It's a sprained ankle.

Josh: Yeah, but Cassie, it's swelled up this morning, and that fact is Reva would never forgive me if I didn't take extra special care of her little sister while she's away in Paris. So there you have it.
Cassie: Not necessary.
Josh: Besides, it's the very least I can do considering the fact you helped be get back Cross Creek.
Cassie: Reva is going to be blown away when she gets home tonight.
Josh: I really couldn't have done it without you.
Cassie: You know what, I have to agree with you. ( Laughter )
Dr. Heartland: Hello, Mrs. Winslow.
Cassie: Hello.
Dr. Heartland: Let me take a look at that ankle.
Cassie: I'm fine. You know, I'm sure it's fine.
Josh: Yeah, just be careful, though, because she needs that ankle for dancing.
Cassie: Excuse me?
Josh: You dance, doctor?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Jeffrey: And you can quote me on this. On the day that I am sworn in as the next mayor, I will make sure that there is a new trauma unit established right here in this hospital.
Blake: And you can quote me on this, the day that I'm sworn in, I will allocate funds for a state of the art neonatal health clinic in memory of my late husband.
Jeffrey: Well that's very touching.
Blake: What are you doing here?
Jeffrey: I'm giving an interview. And you?
Blake: Increasing my lead in the race.
Jeffrey: Well, I got here first and you can take a number.
Reporter: Mr. O'Neill, how about a nice, big, smile for the front page.
Jeffrey: Sure.
Reporter: Mrs. Marler, say cheese.
[SCENE_BREAK]

Lizzie: Don't tell me that you can't find him. Some head of security. Look, one word from me to my grandfather and you will never work in this town again. Find Coop! Ooh, oh, God, not again. What? No, I'm not okay. I am pregnant and I don't know where the father is. Find Coop or file for unemployment. ( Knock on the door ) Oh, Coop, thank you God.
Beth: Hello, sweetie, how are you on this beautiful, spring morning, hmm?
Lizzie: What if he's never coming back, Mom? What if he's gone for good.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Buzz: Coffee black, three sugars. Toast, no butter.
Alan: You know me well, old friend.
Buzz: What do you want, Alan?
Alan: What any father wants. The best for his family, Buzz. That is why I am concerned about Elizabeth and young Henry.
Buzz: Concerned?
Alan: Yes, concerned. Aren't you?
Buzz: You tell me your concern and I'll tell you mine, okay.

Alan: Your son has a chance of a lifetime, Buzz, to attend Oxford University, probably the best university in the English world. They believe in him, and they want him to shoot for the stars. I know you're proud of him--
Buzz: What's your point?

Alan: My point is the last thing he needs right now is to be saddled with a child. Now you and I were young and we know accidents happen, and I think you and I should make sure Elizabeth and Henry learn from this mistake and move on. Put this indiscretion behind them.
Buzz: In other words, you don't think my son is good enough to raise your grandchild?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Ava: Okay. Oh, my gosh. I'm sorry, I'm sorry. I didn't mean to.
Jonathan: All right, whatever. You didn't mean to egg me. Fine.
Ava: You know what, it's been a crazy day. Coop's gone, I'm alone, no one knows where he is. I'm going to put another order in for you.
Jonathan: He took off, huh? I can't say I blame him.
Ava: What?
Jonathan: He's going to be the daddy of Lizzie Spaulding's baby.
Ava: How do you know that?
Jonathan: Tammy.
Ava: So Lizzie says she's pregnant, and Coop's the father. Why should I believe her?
Jonathan: Why shouldn't you?
Ava: It's too easy, too Lizzie. She loses him-- and poof-- all of a sudden she's pregnant.
Jonathan: Wake up and get over it, Ava. Coop's going to be a daddy. You just got to let him go and let Lizzie have him.
Ava: What are you, her new best friend?
Jonathan: No, I just don't want to see you look like a jerk trying to steal the guy away from his baby mama.
Ava: What do you know about this, huh? What do you know about this?
Jonathan: About Lizzie and Coop? They're both freaks. What is that look?
Ava: You spent a little time with Lizzie when you and Tammy broke up. You know something.
Tammy: Hey. I know I'm late, I'm sorry. Hi, Ava. I'm starving, what did you order for me? Hello? Jonathan. What? What did I miss?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Beth: This is how it's going to be for the next nine months. Hormones, emotions going out of control, but your going to have me going through it first.
Lizzie: I'm going to look like you?
Beth: Thanks.

Lizzie: I mean, it's fine, but who cares what you look like at this point. But me, in one of those tent dresses and those shoes. And everybody touching you all of the time, is it a boy, is it a girl, is it triplets?
Beth: You will handle it?
Lizzie: Maybe, but all alone.
Beth: No.
Lizzie: Yes. Coop blew the coop, and now I'm all alone.
Beth: And Coop will come back. But in the meantime...
Lizzie: I know, I know, I have you. It's not enough.
Beth: I wasn't a big fan of you and Coop, but that baby needs a mother and a father. And I'm going to make sure that he or she gets it if it's the last thing I do.
Lizzie: Really?
Beth: Uh-huh. If you want Coop, then I want you to have Coop.
Lizzie: But granddad--
Beth: Don't worry about granddad. I will take care of granddad.
Lizzie: So you're going to help me find Coop?
Beth: First of all, I don't think I'll have to, because I think that once the shock wears off, he'll come back. He's a decent young man.
Lizzie: He's so good. That's why someone like Ava can just-- Ava, if anybody knows where he is it's that giraffe.
Beth: Lizzie, where are you going?
Lizzie: I have to go. But thank you so much. I love you. I feel like myself again.
[SCENE_BREAK]

Alan: Buzz, Buzz, come on. You don't have to get defensive. Now I admit that I blamed young Coop for everything in the very beginning, but I realize now that he's a very intelligent and talented young man. Apparently Oxford shares in my opinion.
Buzz: Why isn't this fine young man good enough to raise your grandchild? Frank, hi. Look, I want you to-- don't hang up! I want you to uh... check on something.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Jonathan: You haven't missed a thing. She's just upset because Coop pulled a Houdini as soon as she heard about the baby.
Tammy: So Lizzie really is pregnant?
Ava: So she says.
Tammy: You think she's lying?
Jonathan: You know what, I would rather have my eggs without gossip. Get on it.
Tammy: Wait, Ava. Ava, what makes you think she's making this up?
Ava: Well, I don't trust her. I mean, are you surprised? Something about this situation it's not right.
Jonathan: Wishful thinking. Eggs, now.
Tammy: I guess anything is possible with Lizzie, but I don't know. Lizzie, maternity clothes. No way. No, not unless--
Ava: Not unless... not unless she is pregnant, actually. I would believe that if--
Tammy: If what?
Ava: If, if, if-- what if she did this to set up Coop, to trap him? What if he's not the father?
Lizzie: Get over yourself, Jonathan, the baby isn't yours.
Tammy: Well, there was that whole thing with that Quinn guy. It could be his.
Ava: No, but she said that she never slept with him. I mean, so who knows.
Jonathan: Guys, drop it. It's Coop's. It's his problem. It's not yours, it's not ours.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Announcer: Flight 19 non-stop to London now boarding gate five. Flight 19, London.
Buzz: London? Coop! Coop.
Coop: Pop-- whoa, whoa, what are you doing here?
Buzz: Look, you get on that plane, you make that choice, it's going to be-- you're going to hate yourself for the rest of your life.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Cassie: Please, would you tell my brother-in-law that I don't need a cane or a walker or even a dance partner.
Dr. Heartland: Just as well, since I've got two left feet. ( Laughter )
Josh: Any other hobbies?
Dr. Heartland: Thank you for asking, but you're not my type. So, just ice it and the ankle will be fine.
Cassie: I will; I'll do that. Thank you, doctor.
Dr. Heartland: You're welcome.
Josh: Thank you.
Dr. Heartland: You're welcome.
Cassie: Why didn't you just come right out and ask him if he likes kids?
Josh: Hey, he seems like a nice guy. It'd be nice to have a doctor in the family, don't you think?
Cassie: In the family?
Josh: I'm just saying.
Cassie: You're saying? You're just saying you think that I'm the kind of woman who can't exist without a man in my life.
Josh: No, that's not at all what I think. And I apologize, okay. I will never try to play cupid again.
Cassie: All right, I'm sorry if I was snipee. That doctor was cute, I mean if you're into that type.
Josh: Are you? I'll take that as a no.
Cassie: Josh, I am doing just fine. I am very happy with my kids and my good friends, and new adventures. I'm great.
Josh: You get no argument from me.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Blake: I'm not sure you lived in Springfield long enough to know what's needed at Cedars or any other part of town for that matter.
Jeffrey: Springfield is a small town and I think I have a handle on what's needed and what's not, thank you.
Blake: How very condescending.
Jeffrey: Did we agree to debate? Is that what we're doing? Debate right here, right now?
Josh: Hi. What's going on here?
Cassie: Is everything all right?
Reporter: You two are both registered voters, right?
Reporter: Who do you trust, the mayor's widow, Blake, or Jeffrey O'Neill?

Cassie: Blake or Jeffrey? Um, well, actually, I haven't decided who I'm going to vote for yet. I... I can tell you that I know them both very well, and I happen to trust them both. I hope that answers your question.
Reporter: Yes.
Reporter: Thanks.
Blake: Okay, guys, why don't you come with me. I have a lot more to tell you. Come on.
Josh: I'll tell you what, I'll bring the car around, okay. You should stay off that ankle.
Jeffrey: Are you all right?
Cassie: Yeah.
Josh: Excuse me.
Jeffrey: I don't think you'll be voting for me. Thanks for what you just said about trusting me.
Cassie: Well, I've spent a lot of time thinking about things since you and I...
Jeffrey: And now you've decided you can trust me?
Cassie: I have decided that I'm a big pain.
Jeffrey: You?
Cassie: Yeah.
Jeffrey: Never.
Cassie: Well, with Tammy and all of my family dramas, I realize that I... well, you never came first.
Jeffrey: Sounds like we both have our regrets.

Cassie: But we're both moving forward, right? I'm working on this new project with Josh that I think it's really going to help a lot of people. And you, look at you, you're really coming out of your shell and running for mayor, going to talk to people and be nice.
Jeffrey: I'm going to talk to people. No one told me about the nice part. I'm not sure about that.
Cassie: Well, I think you're going to do just fine.
Jeffrey: Because of all that you did for me.
Cassie: So, you don't think that our time together was a total loss?
Jeffrey: Cassie, our time together was...
Cassie: Well, Josh is waiting, so I should probably...
Jeffrey: Hey, you better go.
Cassie: Good luck with your campaign.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Buzz: I just don't want you to make the same mistake I made when I was your age.
Coop: Pop, listen...
Buzz: Come on, being a family man, being married drove me crazy. It drove me so crazy I left my son, I left my wife, I chose to fight a war instead of fighting for my family.
Coop: Pop, what I'm trying...
Buzz: Look, you do this, you make this choice, you get on that plane, you can never go back. You listening to what I'm saying.
Coop: Pop, if you would just here me out.
Buzz: No, look, it's not going to be easy. But you've got me, you've got Frank, you've got Harley, you've got Marina.
Coop: Look, Pop!
Buzz: What?
Coop: I'm not going anywhere, okay? I'm not running, I'm not leaving town and I'm not leaving the baby.
Buzz: Uh-huh. What are you doing at the airport then?
Coop: I just came here to see if I could get a refund if it turns out that I can't accept, if I have to give up on this Oxford.
Buzz: First of all, you're not going to have to give up on anything.
Coop: It's just a thought, okay, just an option.
Buzz: You slept here?

Coop: I just needed to drive somewhere. I need to do something. I got here and I felt like I could barely even breathe. I didn't know what was going on, I didn't know what I was going to do, I didn't know what was coming next. So I just sat down. I needed time. I looked around. I saw people, I saw all these strangers going somewhere, doing something. They were all starting out on their adventures. And, you know, it's like I felt like one of them. Even if it was just for like a moment or even two. It's like I felt...
Buzz: You felt what?
Coop: I felt free. I was totally free.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Olivia: Yoo-hoo. What part of "I need a menu" don't you understand, Ava?
Ava: Oh, sorry. I didn't hear you. I was thinking about something else...
Olivia: Hey, hey, what's the matter?
Ava: Sorry.
Olivia: What, are you clumsy or just upset?
Ava: You know, it's nothing. Anyway, do you care?
Olivia: Oh, God, cue the violins.
Ava: What?
Olivia: Listen, we've had our differences, but I don't hate you, okay? In fact, I'm kind of impressed of how well you've handled life since you've been here.
Ava: Well, I'm not feeling that impressive right now.
Olivia: Is this about Lizzie and Coop and the baby? That's some announcement, huh?
Ava: Um... I don't know what to do.
Olivia: Well, you deal. You pick yourself up and you hope that the next guy...
Ava: The next guy? But I want Coop. Coop is who I want. I mean, how can I sit here and watch her lie to him.
Olivia: You think Lizzie is lying?
Ava: It's not that much of a leap.
Olivia: Wouldn't be the first time. But that's a heavy accusation. Do you have any proof?
Ava: Not yet.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Jonathan: Oh, man, the service in this place is really tanking.
Tammy: What if Ava is right about Lizzie? This whole thing is just a mess. There is no way Lizzie is ready.
Jonathan: Yeah, well, ready or not.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Ava: You.
Lizzie: Easy, Ava. It is very important that I avoid stress at this stage of my pregnancy.
Ava: Oh, yeah, if your pregnant. I said "if." You know what, you're going to have to tell the truth and stop telling all these lies, no matter how much it hurts.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Josh: Kim Zimmer, "Inside The Light."

Reva: I also am a big sports freak myself. I watch a lot of sports on television. Last Christmas, we skied at Beaver Creek, and this year we skied in Vail. I'm lucky to be alive. ( Laughs ) See Reva, Wednesday, May 3, "Inside The Light."
[SCENE_BREAK]
Lizzie: Get away from me, Stretch.
Ava: Do you think that we're a bunch of fools? You just happen to show up pregnant about a minute before Coop is ready to walk out on you.
Lizzie: You know what, that's how it happened. Things happen for a reason.
Ava: If you really care about Coop, really care about him, then you'll tell the truth, Lizzie, and you'll let him off the hook. Tell the truth. He deserves it.
Lizzie: I already did. I'm pregnant. It's Coop's. I didn't try to trap anyone. Henry and I were in love... are in love, and our baby came from that love.
Ava: ( Scoffs ) This is so unbelievable.
Lizzie: God, look who's talking. If anyone is trying to trap him, it's you.
Ava: Trap...
Lizzie: What will it take for you to get out of this town and let us live our lives? We were happy until you came along.
Olivia: All right, time out, time out. Just go back to your corners.
Lizzie: You have put so much pressure on Coop.
Ava: I put pressure on Coop?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Tammy: I think maybe I should go over there.
Jonathan: I think maybe you should not get involved in that.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Olivia: Stop it! It's enough. I am sorry, but you have got to back off. You may not like this, but she has a lot on her plate right now. She's going to be a mother.
Ava: Yeah, a mother. What kind of mother do you think she's going to be?
Olivia: I don't know. You know, good mothers aren't always born that way. People thought I'd be a lousy mother, I'm doing okay. I'm going to give Lizzie the benefit of the doubt.
Lizzie: Thank you, Olivia.
Olivia: On the other hand, I know what it's like to be on the receiving end of the Spaulding power play. It's not fun. I just hope you won't use this baby to hurt anyone, Lizzie.
Lizzie: Stop it. Look, all I want to do is make a life for my baby. I want my baby to have a real family-- a mommy and a daddy.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Tammy: I think I should go over there.
Jonathan: Wait.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Lizzie: Is it too much to ask for?
Tammy: Thank you. Be right there. Hey, Lizzie, what's wrong?
Lizzie: Everything. Everyone hates me. I'm all alone.
Tammy: No, no, you're not.
Lizzie: You know?
Tammy: Yeah, yeah. Anyway, listen, if there is anything that I can do, any way that I can help...
Lizzie: Thank you. You have no idea how grateful I am to have some people on my side.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Ava: Can you believe her?
Jonathan: I can't believe you forgot my hashed browns.
Ava: You know what, I need to get some air because obviously Tammy has more of a stomach for this than I do.
Jonathan: I know. I know. I have a hard time dealing with Lizzie, too.
Ava: For some reason, I don't believe you.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Coop: I sat up all night reading.
Buzz: Travel guides? I mean, New Zealand, Nepal? They didn't have Pluto?
Coop: Come on, Pops. There is so much I haven't even done yet.
Buzz: Look, you can do all the things you want to do and you can go to Oxford, too? You can.
Coop: With a baby? What, strapped in one of those backpack things? Come on.
Buzz: Coop. You're not going to have to do this alone. Lizzie has her family, you have yours.
Coop: ( Laughs )
Buzz: What?
Coop: I mean, if you were me, would you feel comfortable having a Spaulding raise your kid? You know they've screwed up every child they've laid their hands on. Come on.

Buzz: They have the Cooper's to balance them out. It's not going to be easy, I know that. But you can handle having a child and do some of the things you want to do. This is important. You got me, okay? I promise you-- I swear to you-- I'll do everything I can to help. Come here.
Coop: Thanks. ( Laughs )
Buzz: What?
Coop: You know, my kid is going to be pretty lucky to have a granddad like you.
Buzz: I'll baby-sit, give ice cream and give out advice.
Coop: I hope so.
Buzz: But you and Lizzie are going to have to do the big stuff.
Coop: Wait, wait...
Buzz: Calm down, let it sink in. Let's go home. Please? Come on.
Coop: All right.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Ava: When Coop sent Lizzie packing, you were there.
Jonathan: Yeah, I wanted to make sure she didn't boil any bunnies. So?
Ava: Yeah, so... I want to know what you know about all of this?
Jonathan: Me?
Ava: Yeah. You'd be a perfect confidant?
Jonathan: Do I look like somebody's confidant?
Ava: You would be the perfect person if someone was going to do something bad.
Jonathan: I talked to Brad right before he left Jen.
Ava: Did you help Lizzie? You can answer me or I'll ask you again when Tammy gets here.
Jonathan: Okay, okay. Yeah, Lizzie wanted my help with you. She offered me a car, cash prizes to keep you busy while she stole your keys.
Ava: Stole my keys?
Jonathan: What's this world coming to? She wanted to break into your room and dig up dirt on you. I told her to keep the car, keep the cash prizes, keep the hell away. You proud of me?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Lizzie: At least you two are not like Ava and everyone else in this town that's judging me.
Tammy: Ava's in shock.
Lizzie: That's no excuse. She came after me like a pit bull.
Tammy: Well, I would, too. Mom? I'll be right back.
Josh: Hey, Tammy, darling.
Tammy: Hi, Uncle Josh. How did everything go at Cross Creek?
Cassie: Well, let's see. I almost broke my ankle, got hit on by an old coot.
Josh: And she doesn't mean me, by the way. In fact, thanks to your mom, Cross Creek is currently being completely restored.
Tammy: Wow. Well, come on, I want to hear all about it. Tell me.
Jonathan: Hey, Cas. Welcome back, bud.
Josh: Thank you. I really appreciate that.
Jonathan: Yeah, so, welcome back. Did you talk to mama bear?
Josh: Yeah, yeah, she is going to be home later.
Jonathan: Cool, cool. I can't wait to tell her about your and Cassie's vacation together.
Josh: You know what, you're going to want to keep that a secret.
Jonathan: ( Laughs ) Wow!
Josh: Listen, the whole point is for her to have her have a nice surprise to come back to. In fact, I would like for you to be part of that surprise.
Jonathan: Me? How?
Josh: Yeah, I want you to promise me you're done hurting Reva or hurting her family in any way. Well?
Jonathan: Yeah, I'm done.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Logan: Jeffrey, you said you wanted a heads-up on anything new with Ross Marler's plane crash.
Jeffrey: Yeah, what do you got?
Logan: Nicole Landers, Ross' assistant, turns out she's a P.I.
Jeffrey: Tell me something I don't know.
Logan: Ross hired her.
Jeffrey: Now, why would Ross want a private investigator?
Logan: I don't know, we're still working on that.
Jeffrey: Maybe he was having a private affair with his private eye?
Logan: Not too likely. Since she and her partner are going on ten years.
Jeffrey: Well, I guess whatever Ross and his assistant were up to, it didn't include sex. ( Knocks on door ) Hello, Blake.
Blake: Am I interrupting?
Jeffrey: Well, to be honest, I was kind of talking strategy...
Logan: We can finish this another time. I'll be in touch.
Jeffrey: Thanks. I'll see you later. Oh, please, come right in. What can I do for you?
Blake: Got a minute or two right now?
Jeffrey: Right now, I'm sorry, no.
Blake: Really, that's too bad. Because whatever it is, it's going to have to wait, because I won't.
Jeffrey: You, you... what are you doing?
Blake: It's a really good question, Jeffrey. What am I doing? Here I am. I'm going to fund-raisers five nights a week, trying to keep Ross' legacy alive. I'm eating rubber chickens...
Jeffrey: Rubber chicken?
Blake: I'm giving speach after speach, shaking hands until I'm numb and for what? What really, a dead cheating husband who dumped me for some glorified gopher. What's wrong with me?
Jeffrey: Um, there's not a thing wrong with you that I can see Blake, but listen about that assistant and Ross, there is something...
Blake: Am I sexy, am I exciting?
Jeffrey: Blake, you're...
Blake: Tell me.
Jeffrey: You're...
Blake: Mm. ( Laughter )
Jeffrey: What was that?
Blake: The overture.
Jeffrey: Blake, I... what are you doing?
Blake: All right, fine. Reality check here.
Jeffrey: Yeah.
Blake: Well, you see, we both want the same job, and that's competition. It's just very sexy.
Jeffrey: Competition, sexy... that's crazy, you're crazy.
Blake: If you weren't such a nice guy.
Jeffrey: I'm not a nice guy.
Blake: I would say that you might think that was a pathetic attempt to get back at my dead, cheating husband.
Jeffrey: Yeah. That's what I thought.
Blake: But you know what they say about politics?
Jeffrey: What?
Blake: They make very stranger bedfellows.
Jeffrey: Yeah, well, not this strange.
Blake: You want to get over Cassie and I'm trying so hard to get past Ross.
Jeffrey: Blake, listen, about Ross, there is something...

Blake: No, no, no. Don't say anything... I don't want to hear about it. Shut up. Please, shut up. Don't rub my face in this. Please. I'm so tired. I don't want to hear about Ross or Nicole, or his affairs or...
Jeffrey: Okay.
Blake: ...Demographics or speeches or fund-raisers or positions!
Jeffrey: Yeah.
Blake: You want a position, I'll give you a position.
Jeffrey: Yeah?
Blake: You want this? You want it? Tell me. Answer the damn question. Answer it now.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Tammy: They were really able to hunt down all their old stuff?
Cassie: Yeah, we found most of it. We had to rough some people up to get them to sell.
Tammy: You're vicious.

Cassie: I can be when it's for a good cause. Which reminds me, the best part wasn't even renovating the place for Reva's surprise. It was actually that Josh found these plans that his father had drawn up for a rehabilitation community/hospital for injured soldiers. It's a great project, and he wants to build it on part of the property.
Tammy: That does sound like a great project.
Cassie: And I am hopping onboard.
Tammy: He asked you to help?
Cassie: I gave him no choice.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Jonathan: Josh, I'm really happy now. I don't have to mess with anybody else's life because I've finally got one of my own now.
Josh: Well, that's great, Jonathan. No, it's really great. It's so great, I'm going to give you a little advice.
Josh: Really? Advice about what?
Jonathan: I'm going to show you how you hold onto Reva for real this time.
[SCENE_BREAK]
( Door slams )
Lizzie: Coop, oh, thank God, you're back.
Coop: Whoa, Lizzie. Stop. Look, we've got a lot we have a lot to talk about, okay?
Lizzie: Yeah, we do.
